greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=11 instead of a(1)=2.
link: A. R. Booker, S. A. Irvine, The Euclid-Mullin graph, arXiv preprint arXiv:1508.03039, 2015
mathematica: a[1]=11; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a,10]
program: first(m)=my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=11; for(i=2, m, v[i]=lpf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v;
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
ext: Corrected and extended by _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 13 2008
